history.title: Sid Jacobson, Comic Book Writer With Range, Dies at 92
history.description: His portfolio included the adventures of Richie Rich and graphic treatments of 9/11 and torture by the C.I.A. He also wrote dozens of songs.

history.title: Pattrakorn Tungsupakul on ‘Thirteen Lives’ and the Rescue
history.description: For Ron Howard’s retelling of the 2018 ordeal, Pattrakorn Tungsupakul not only played the mother of a stranded boy, she also made key script contributions.

history.title: HBO Max and Discovery+ to Be Combined in 2023
history.description: The company also said it would launch, next summer, a combined paid service that would reach 130 million subscribers by 2025.

history.title: New York Times Reports a Gain of 180,000 Digital Subscribers
history.description: Revenue from digital advertising fell slightly in the second quarter, but subscription revenue continued to rise sharply, the company said.

history.title: Vin Scully, Voice of the Dodgers for 67 Years, Dies at 94
history.description: The team has had many great players since World War II, but it was Mr. Scully, a gifted storyteller and a master of the graceful phrase, who became the enduring face of the franchise.

history.title: Burt Metcalfe, Who Left His Mark on ‘M*A*S*H,’ Is Dead at 87
history.description: He was the showrunner of the classic Korean War sitcom for its last six seasons, notably casting David Ogden Stiers as the pompous surgeon Winchester.

history.title: New York Times Names Matt Purdy Editor at Large
history.description: He has helped guide many of the newsroom’s most ambitious projects in recent years.

history.title: Forbes Explores Sale After SPAC Deal Collapses
history.description: Forbes has tapped Citigroup to sell at a price of at least the $630 million valuation declared in its earlier plan to go public.

history.title: CNN Profits Are Down as Ratings Plummet
history.description: The network is on a pace to drop below $1 billion in profit for the first time in years, according to people familiar with its operations, amid steep declines in TV viewership.

history.title: Bad Bunny Reigns Again Before Beyoncé’s Chart Arrival
history.description: The Puerto Rican pop star logs a seventh week at No. 1 on the Billboard album chart; numbers for “Renaissance,” Beyoncé’s latest, arrive next week.

history.title: After Pixar Ouster, John Lasseter Returns With Apple and ‘Luck’
history.description: John Lasseter was toppled five years ago by allegations about his workplace behavior. He’s back with an animated film and a studio that could be Pixar 2.0.

history.title: Fox News, Once Home to Trump, Now Often Ignores Him
history.description: The former president hasn’t been interviewed on the Rupert Murdoch-owned cable network in more than 100 days, and other Republicans often get the attention he once did.

history.title: Larry Josephson, Champion of Free-Form Radio, Dies at 83
history.description: His dyspeptic morning show helped make WBAI-FM in New York a vibrant, eccentric, alternative radio haven. “I was the first angry man in morning radio,” he said.

history.title: Antenna Group Emerges as Bidder for Vice Media
history.description: Vice Media, which is exploring a sale of its business, has a longstanding relationship with the Greek broadcaster.

history.title: The New Podcast ‘Into It’ Reintroduces Sam Sanders
history.description: After 12 years at NPR, the former host of “It’s Been a Minute” is stepping out with a new pop culture podcast — uncensored, uninhibited and unbothered.

history.title: ‘Wagatha Christie’ Trial: Judge Finds No Libel
history.description: The High Court in London ruled against the plaintiff, Rebekah Vardy, putting an end to a social media feud that turned into a high-profile legal face-off.

history.title: Sheila Rayam Is Named Executive Editor of The Buffalo News
history.description: Ms. Rayam, 55, the first Black journalist to lead the paper, will take over as its community still reels from one of the deadliest racist massacres in recent American history.

history.title: Why a Vogue Cover Created a Controversy for Olena Zelenska
history.description: Is the magazine romanticizing war, or is the first lady weaponizing glossies?

history.title: Tim Giago, Native American Newspaperman, Is Dead at 88
history.description: The founder of the first independent American Indian newspaper braved gunshots and firebombs to provide an unvarnished look at life on the reservation.

history.title: How Los Angeles Times Handled Exposé Becomes the Talk of the Town
history.description: A book by a reporter from the newspaper has ignited debate about the way editors dealt with an explosive article he helped write in 2017.
